did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Anna Eliza Caroline Partin Papers 1916, undated
did.abstract: Handwritten memoir by Anna Eliza Caroline Partin about her experiences in Petersburg and Richmond, Virginia during the Civil War, particularly the siege of Petersburg. Biographical information on Anna Eliza Caroline Partin, John William Partin, the Bunkley Family and the Ferrebee Family. Copy of picture who may be Anna Eliza Caroline Partin. The biographical and genealogy folders are photocopies of a handwritten scroll.
did.origination: Partin, Anna Eliza CarolineBunkley FamilyFerrebee FamilyPartin, John William arrangement

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Anna Eliza Caroline Partin Papers, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center from purchased. on 00/00/2008.

appraisal.head: Appraisal Information
appraisal.p: The biographical and genealogy scrolls were crumbling and already fragmented when accessioned. After photocopying the original scrolls, they were discarded.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Lived in and near Petersburg, Virginia during the Civil War.  Possibly born in Isle of Wight County, Virginia, daughter of Henry W. Neville. Married to John William Partin.  After the Civil War, they lived in Portsmouth, Virginia. Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Anna Eliza Caroline Partin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Handwritten memoir by Anna Eliza Caroline Partin about her experiences in Petersburg and Richmond, Virginia during the Civil War, particularly the siege of Petersburg. Biographical information on Anna Eliza Caroline Partin, John William Partin, the Bunkley Family and the Ferrebee Family. Copy of picture who may be Anna Eliza Caroline Partin. The biographical and genealogy folders are photocopies of a handwritten scroll.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

did.unittitle: Remembrances of the War Between the States by Mrs. A.E. C. Partin of Portsmouth, Virginia.
Anna Eliza Caroline Partin and the Bunkley Family
Ferrebee, Forby, Ferby, Fereby, Ferebe and Ferebee Family Genealogy
